results.title: The Rockhoppers
results.creator_credit: Betti Wood, Ossie Emery and Pilgrim Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt discusses the do’s and dont’s of rock fishing for blackfish along the coast of Australia. He points out the need for special care in this exciting sport due to the unpredictable weather and tidal conditions, which cause many people to lose their lives by drowning.

results.title: The Rocket
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison, Associated British-Pathe, Rayant Pictures and William Pollard
results.brief_description: Illustrates the progress of the rocket from a Chinese firecracker, through various 17th century inspirations for space travel, to its applications today. Shows scenes of Britain’s rocket research establishments; points out the part played rockets in World War II., and describes some American post-war experiments in rocket development.

results.title: The Rock of love = Sakhrat al hub
results.creator_credit: Egyptian Film Company and Rida Myassar
results.brief_description: Karima and Aadel are both escaping painful pasts and guarded secrets in Egypt. They meet in Beirut, a city where they find peace and where they fall in love. But as always, the road to love is a thorny one and they must both come to terms with their fears. For Karima, it is being stalked - is it the detective who is constantly turning up wherever she goes, or some other darker stranger? And Aadel must come to terms with his fears after a loveless marriage which ended in him brutally murdering his wife - for which he was imprisoned for one year! Starring Samira Ahmad and Aamad Homdy. In Arabic with no English subtitles.

results.title: The Rock
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Michael Bay
results.brief_description: Action thriller set on the island of Alcatraz where 81 tourist hostages are being held by a somewhat unstable Marine Corps general called Francis X. Hummel (Ed Harris). The ransom is $100 million for war reparations to the families of servicemen killed in covert operations and if this is not paid then Hummel and his men will bomb San Francisco with deadly gas. Enter FBI chemical weapons expert Stanley Goodspeed (Nicolas Cage) and former British spy Jack Patrick Mason (Sean Connery) whose assignment is to penetrate Alcatraz and stop Hummel at all cost. Fast-paced and frenetic.

results.title: The Rock
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and World Mirror
results.brief_description: A travelogue of Gibraltar. The atmosphere of cosmopolitan bustle in the busy streets and cafes; the holidaymakers on the sunlit beaches; the mixed uniforms of soldiers, sailors and airmen stationed at “Gib”; the famous Barbary Apes; the Ceremony of the Keys in the fortress.

results.title: The Robots are coming
results.creator_credit: Hilary Henson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A look at what part robots play in the world today and what research into robot technology is likely to produce in the future. Present day (1970s) robots are used in industry to perform a wide range of tasks considered unsuitable for people because they are dangerous, dirty, or monotonous. They are still fairly simple, with primitive “brains”, but recent research into robot technology could make them far more flexible. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: The Robot moles
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company, Masaji Hara, Matsue Jimbo and Tadanori Okamoto
results.brief_description: Japanese animated puppet film. Hanako, a little girl who loves flowers, makes a drawing of a mechanical mole which would cultivate flowers. The scientists mistake it for an order to construct such a device, and build a team of robot moles.

results.title: The Robin Klein video
results.creator_credit: Christine McCaul Gleitzman, Mike Waters and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Celebrated children’s author Robin Klein discusses her lifelong passion with creative writing and the ideas process that never stops. In particular, she talks about the importance of “mooning about,” and the mooning and locales that have provided the source of inspiration behind “Halfway across the galaxy and turn left”, “Hating Alison Ashley” and the Penny Pollard series. The program provides practical examples of observations that can be made from everyday encounters, such as at an historic railway station or spending time round a school. She speaks of her own personal style of writing, the first draft, the importance of self discipline, tools of the trade and the importance of the editorial process. Robin’s books are enjoyed by children of all ages and have been adapted for stage and screen.

results.title: The Robin
results.creator_credit: Gateway Educational Films, Donald Eastman and Rosemary Eastman
results.brief_description: A study of the robin and its relationship with man. Courtship behaviour, nest building and the rearing of young are shown in detail and the differences between migratory and non-migratory birds is explained.
